notable_quotes.speaker: Lienard Jean Lienard
notable_quotes.french: En fin il commenca a dire haultement qu'on luy ensorcelloit son enfant et des bestials, Mais sy l'on ny mestoit remede et guerison, il en feroit prendre et brusler, et desquelz propos ledit Cbrestien en fut assez adverty
notable_quotes.english: In the end he began to say loudly that someone was bewitching his child and animals, but if a remedy and cure were not found, he would have them seized and burned, and of these words the said Chrétien was well informed
notable_quotes.context: Witness 5 threatening to take action against witches after his child fell ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Huillier
notable_quotes.french: luy et aultres bourgeois de Moriviller devisioient des sorciers qui font tant de maulx journellement et sur ce le deposant prenans la parole ramena en jeu ledit Chrestien prevenu du bruict qu'il avoit d'estre sorcier, et que l'apparence en estoit bien grande veu que sa propre mere l'avoit accusé de ce crime avec aultres propos
notable_quotes.english: He and other bourgeois of Moriviller were discussing the witches who do so much harm daily, and on this the witness taking the floor brought up the said Chrétien, suspected by the rumor he had of being a witch, and that the appearance was very great given that his own mother had accused him of this crime with other statements

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrétien Pierre
notable_quotes.french: et prevoyant que sur telle accusation ung chacun fuyroit sa conversation, sa resolution estoit avant qu'il fut esté quinze jours (s'il ne fut esté apprehendé) de vendre tout son bien à demeure claire, et se rendre en quelque religion si on luy eut voulu recepvoir
notable_quotes.english: and foreseeing that upon such accusation everyone would flee his company, his resolution was before fifteen days had passed (if he had not been apprehended) to sell all his goods at a clear residence, and render himself to some religious order if they would receive him
notable_quotes.context: Chrétien explaining why he tried to flee

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrétien Pierre
notable_quotes.french: sy confessant estre sorcier, il dampne la poinct son ame
notable_quotes.english: if confessing to be a witch, does he not damn his soul
notable_quotes.context: Chrétien asking judges multiple times before confessing

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrétien Pierre
notable_quotes.french: Dit que non et n'en avoit garde estimant que dirant a son curé qu'il estoit pescheur, et se confessoit de tous les péchés qu'il avoit commis cela suffisait, sans autrement particulariser quelz estoient ses péchés
notable_quotes.english: Said no and had no intention, estimating that saying to his priest that he was a sinner, and confessing all the sins he had committed was sufficient, without otherwise specifying what his sins were
notable_quotes.context: Asked if he had confessed to his priest about being tempted by the devil

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows clear pattern of social tensions and property disputes. Accused attempted to flee after being named by previously convicted witch. Confessed under threat of torture (thumbscrews applied but not tightened). Named many local people as accomplices seen at sabbat, though judges warned him against false accusations. Economic disputes (fruit trees, land leases, theft accusations, payment disagreements) preceded most alleged harms. Mother's prior accusation and execution was major factor in reputation.
